reviews.review:
So...i've been playing this game for over 500h!!!!
I think it's a good game, a survival game with a bit of horror.
1ST OF ALL I NEVER PLAY KILLER!!!
It's very funny when you play with friends...and the bugs that the game has, from time to time, are just the best part, cuz you will always be caught off guard.
Prepare yourself for the huge hitboxes that killers have.
It has realistic sounds and consistent graphics for the genre that the game wants to transmit.
It's a game that is predictable...just play 3 games to get a sense of how the rest of the day will go...good or bad.
√éf you don't know if you would get this game or not just watch some gameplays.
For me...a person that is not good in game...cuz if a have to press more than 3 keys at the same time i will mess it up...it's pretty basic and it's not a fast game that you need to have fast reactions.
About the people that you find in game...let's just say that you will find all types of people...but with luck you will find your best friend, your sister, your bro...or even your partner.
If you find toxic people...just remember...it's a game and not everyone has the same mindset...and you can always say "FLOWERS TO ALL <3"
a hell yea. verty good game
Jogo mto bom, principalmente jogando com amigos
BEST  GAME EVER MADE JUST FIX HITBOXES AND WE GOOD

Although the game came out in 2016, it is a very good game to which updates are made very often. It's also a competitive game so you can get it out of it fast. In conclusion it is worth buying the game to those who like competitive and team games.

[strike] Dead by Daylight is an interesting, rewarding game that is also a bit rough around the edges. This review is written with about 85% of my time split between killer, and 15% going to the survivor role. I initially enjoyed the killer role much more than the survivor role, but recently several friends and I have started playing survivor together and it is very fun. I have reached red ranks on both roles, but am a more consistently strong killer than I am a strong survivor. 

Every game is new and despite being played on the same general map framework. Every map has various RNG elements that cause the maps to be different enough each time that the variety of gameplay is quite high. Map design varies tremendously and presents a lot of nuanced mechanics for both sides, from survivors needing to understand when an area of the map is unsafe to killers having to forgo a chase with a survivor because that portion of the map is too strong. 

In Dead by Daylight, matchmaking ranks are the inverse of most other multiplayer games; lower rank numbers typically indicate higher/more skilled players and higher rank numbers typically indicate lower/less skilled players. This does come with some caveat, however, as the skill rating is system is currently complicated by a system that rewards and demerits certain gameplay styles. For example, killers earn points based on "winning" chases with survivors by injuring or downing them early on in the chase, whereas survivors earn points by elongating chases or stunning killers. Some killers, like the trapper, are extremely strong at controlling certain areas and in order to "win" their game, trappers usually end up losing objectives while they set up traps to begin their control. This can cause lower points in the objective category for trappers, resulting in a potentially lower match score. 

Some development choices are also questionable. The dev team can seem a bit disconnected at times from their game, and tend overall to take the side of survivor feedback more than killer feedback. That being said, map design is very good in terms of visuals and sound design is impeccable. The sound in DBD is some of the best I have heard in any game. Chase music, menu music, survivor cries of pain and even killer breathing all sound genuine and have substance. Killers do not sound "human" in their breathing because they are inhuman. More than a few are undead, several are incorporeal, and all of them are murderous and worthy of the "killer" title. 

Overall: I highly recommend DBD at full price to those looking for a fun game with interesting mechanics, a reasonable learning curve, and something to sink their time into. Like all multiplayer games toxicity is prevalent and can be highbut if you can get past that the core mechanics are very fun and unique. The game overall presents a lot of challenge, rewards high mechanical skill, and offers a ton of replayability. If you can learn to disconnect yourself from others' feeling like you didn't play the way they wanted you to play, the game is very fun. I would give DBD an 8.5/10, and a perfect score could be achieved by fixing bugs and evening out some killer powers across the board, along with more unique perks for survivors. [/strike]

I still like the game - it's perfect to have fun with friends. Better to play in a party because you can't rely on random teammates at all because you never know what teammates you might have. The game is still developing and getting new killers, skins, maps and perks. 
Once you start you might know nothing like in any other game, but the more you play the better you can be in the game - learning the gens' and totems' location, the best spots for jumps and loops etc. 
Of course, I personally had a lot of troubles and moments of hate. But if a game starts to get on your nerves - just take a break and do something else. With time, help of your friends and twitch streamers you really can master the game -or, at least, start having fun. I recommend.
